item.content:encoded:
This is a solo project that mimics a lot of what MineCraft does, it’s a voxel-world that is generated using procedural generation, namely using several Fractional Brownian Motions (FBM’s) for generation and 3D FBM’s to generate cave systems.

To get good frame rates in the game the generator is not using any primitives for generating the world, instead it’s building the blocks out of quads. This way we can also combine all the blocks in a chunk to be a single mesh and any quad that isn’t visible will not be rendered.

View post on imgur.com

As seen in the start of the above gif we can see the different FBM’s that are responsible for the different layers in the world. It’s very easy to add more layers and the layers can overlap eachother. For instance, the bottom two FBM’s are the points in which diamond can spawn.

Here is the generation in action, each chunk contains the data for 1000 blocks, and in this example we generate 10x5x10 blocks.
